medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began acutely 6 hours prior, waking the patient from sleep. It is described as sharp and crampy, intermittent, and localizes initially to the periumbilical area before becoming localized to the RLQ. The patient reports associated nausea but denies vomiting, with normal bowel movements and normal oral intake. The patient has also experienced fevers, documented at 101.2Â°F in the ED.
medical_history.family_history: Negative for Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, or irritable bowel syndrome.
